keyPolicies.policyDescription: Throughout my political life I have always described myself as a 'One Nation Tory', a progressive Conservative who believes in social values and individual freedom as well as free market economics. I believe in a fair, meritocratic society in which every individual is encouraged to aspire to achieve the best of his or her abilities.

I support a strong line against terroristic threats against those who are genuinely capable of reforming themselves, I support a strongly supporting providing the use of a carrot rather than just a big stick.

issues.economy: Kenneth Clarke has advocated a Loan Guarantee Scheme to back the banks to give credit to small and medium sized businesses during the credit crunch. Kenneth has the criticisms of the Markets when they need credit.
issues.governance: Kenneth Clarke voted against the 42-day detention without charge and has raised concerns about too many powers given to the state.

leaflet.personalStatement: Throughout my political life I have always described myself as a 'One Nation Tory', a progressive Conservative who believes in social values and individual freedom as well as free market economics. I believe in a fair, meritocratic society in which every individual is encouraged to aspire to achieve the best of his or her abilities.

contactInformation.address: Rushcliffe House, 17-19 Rectory Road, West Bridgford, Nottingham, NG2 6BE

images.caption: Kenneth Clarke has pursued a dedicated interest in his role as constituency MP with travels both at home and abroad.
Kenneth Clarke voted against the 42-day detention without charge and has raised concerns about too many powers given to the state.
Kenneth Clarke has advocated a Loan Guarantee Scheme to back the banks to give credit to small and medium sized businesses during the credit crunch.
